Package com.example.project4

Class StoreOrderController

java.lang.Object
com.example.project4.StoreOrderController
public class StoreOrderController extends Object
This class contains methods that allows the user to view all the orders placed so far, make any final changes, and export the order.
Author:
David Fabian, Steven Tan

  • Constructor Details

    • StoreOrderController

      public StoreOrderController()

  • Method Details

    • setMainController

      public void setMainController(StoreFrontController controller)
      Sets the main controller to the StoreFrontController
      Parameters:
      controller - StoreFrontController for which to set this instance's main controller reference to.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the total price text field and list view component by setting the default values for each.

    • setOrder

      public void setOrder()
      Sets the order list view and the text field displaying the price of the order to the first order in the list of all store orders. This method is called immediately after setting the Main Controller containing the reference to all the non-cancelled store orders. Notifies the user if there are no placed orders.

    • changeOrder

      protected void changeOrder()
      Updates the currently user-viewed order by switching to the store order selected by the user in the Combo box. Updates the order list view and the total price listed in the view according the new selected order.

    • cancelOrder

      protected void cancelOrder()
      Cancels the currently user-viewed order and removes it from the list of all store orders. It updates the currently user-viewed order by switching to the first order currently in the list of store orders, if any.

    • exportOrder

      protected void exportOrder()
      Creates a text file in the format "Order-(Store Order #).txt" and writes all the item descriptions (that the currently user-viewed order contains) into that text file. Notifies the user of any errors in the file creation and updates the currently user-viewed order by switching to another, if any.

    • updateDisplayedItems

      private void updateDisplayedItems()
      Updates the displayed items in the order List view. Called the controller is first invoked and whenever the user switches store orders in the Combo box.

    • updatePrice

      private void updatePrice()
      Updates the price listed for the current store order being viewed by the user. If there are no store orders, "$0.00" is set as the text.
